description: From French diplomate, a back-formation from diplomatique (“diplomatic”), ultimately from Ancient Greek δίπλωμα (díplōma, “double-folded document”).

entries.meaning: A person, such as an ambassador, who is accredited to represent a government officially in its relations with other governments or international organisations
examples:
In a meeting with a top Chinese diplomat last year, Moon said China was partly responsible for South Korea’s pollution problem.
.mw-parser-output .k-player .k-attribution{visibility:hidden}Audio (US)(file)

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Someone who uses skill and tact in dealing with other people
